elements.title: Abbas II of Persia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the reign of Abbas II of Persia (pictured) was marked by peace with neighbouring nations, except for a war with the Mughal Empire in 1649 to recover the city of Kandahar?

elements.title: Green Valley State Park (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Green Valley State Park in Iowa, which was dedicated exactly 69 years ago, had multiple species of fish added to its artificial lake in 1974?

elements.title: Helen Potrebenko (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to Modern Times, a San Francisco–based bookstore collective, if there was only one book that you read in 1975 it had to be Canadian author and activist Helen Potrebenko's Taxi!?

elements.title: Duesenberg (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Duesenberg car was the first American car to win a French Grand Prix, doing so in 1921?

elements.title: one in Dehradun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that besides official retreats in Hyderabad and in Shimla, the president of India also has one in Dehradun?

elements.title: Zita Moulton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that actress Zita Moulton first starred in theatre performances after a bet with her fiancé that she would be able to get a stage job within 24 hours?

elements.title: raid on Kronstadt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 48 of the 55 British participants in the August 1919 raid on Kronstadt received gallantry medals or were mentioned in despatches?

elements.title: Lim Kok Wing (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Malaysian businessman Lim Kok Wing was depicted as "King of Africa"?
